properties.title: Apache James Server 3 - Deleted Messages Vault Configuration

body.p: Deleted Messages Vault is the component in charge of retaining messages before they are going to be deleted. Messages stored in the Deleted Messages Vault could be deleted after exceeding their retentionPeriod (explained below). It also supports to restore or export messages matching with defined criteria in WebAdmin deleted messages vault document by using WebAdmin endpoints

section.name: Deleted Messages Vault Configuration
section.p: Note: This feature requires Guice wiring. To make James use DeletedMessageVault, you need to configure the PreDeletionHook for it. Example is at Mailbox Listener Configuration

The Deleted Messages Vault also stores and manages deleted messages into a BlobStore. The BlobStore can be either based on an object storage or on Cassandra. For configuring the BlobStore the vault will use, you can look at BlobStore Configuration.

subsection.name: deletedMessageVault.properties
subsection.p: Consult deletedMessageVault.properties to get some examples and hints.

dl.dd: Allows to enable or disable usage of the Deleted Message Vault. Default to false.
Deleted messages stored in the Deleted Messages Vault are expired after this period (default: 1 year). It can be expressed in y years, d days, h hours, ...
Messages restored from the Deleted Messages Vault are placed in a mailbox with this name (default: Restored-Messages>). The mailbox will be created if it does not exist yet.
